title: Football shirt

author: FigoGalactic

comments.content:
5. Benecol: E&F or ITC Cerigo (Medium and Italic)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182119im_/http:/typophile.com/files/yogur2_3604.jpg)

2. Colanta is most likely drawn by hand. Some typefaces that capture a similar look and feel:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/kari/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/kari/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/kari/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/number-five/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182119/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/number-five/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/number-five/")

Colanta almost looks like Doyald Young's [Eclat](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317182119/http:/www.fonts.com/font/image-club/eclat/regular/web-font) manually condensed a bit and then "trimmed" here and there.

Mike, I think you're right.

The C, a (top), and t (top) are a dead-on match, the top of the l has been angled to match the top of the t, the o cleaned up, and the bottom of the vertical strokes of the l, a, n, and t spiked.

Great eye.
